body:
I just had a look at this and it seems that rclone uses the `mime` include for go. This references a mime type file that doesn't seem to exist in termux. `/etc/mime.types`
[https://golang.org/pkg/mime/#TypeByExtension](https://golang.org/pkg/mime/#TypeByExtension).
[https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/mime/type_unix.go](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/mime/type_unix.go)


I created this file in `/data/data/com.termux/files/usr/etc/mime.types` but no luck.  However, with root if you create `/etc/mime.types`, the same as in Debian it works as expected.

Seems to be more of an issue with go/mime or termux rather than rclone itself.

@mt025 that is a very interesting observation - thank you.

I had a look at the go source and yes you are right, unless termux patches the go source then it will be looking in `/etc/mime.types` I think...

Termux doesn't appear to patch go for that so potentially it could be if someone wanted to make a patch: https://github.com/termux/termux-packages/tree/master/packages/golang

However, looking at the serve dlna code, I see it is using the mime type database to read the mime type from the file name. However most backends know the mime type so we could ask the backend itself...

I implemented that here... That means it may start working for a drive backend (but won't for a local backend)

@serovar Can you give this a go?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-218-ge2a5e2c9-fix-3475-dlna-mime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Or build it from the `fix-3475-dlna-mime` branch might be better!

If that doesn't work then we'll have to work on a patch for the go package in Termux.

I built the package from the `fix-3475-dlna-mime` branch, but unfortunately it has the same problem.

<details>
<summary>Here is the log</summary>
$rclone/rclone -vv serve dlna Drive-crypted:

> I built the package from the `fix-3475-dlna-mime` branch, but unfortunately it has the same problem.
> 
> Here is the log

Can you try serving something from an unencrypted drive remote?

> It works!

Can you compare with the original version - I suspect that won't work?

OK try this on the encrypted drive - hopefully it will work :-)

I added a very small number of mimetypes to go's internal store which should cover the most common audio and video files, hopefully that will work for you!

Find that on the same branch `fix-3475-dlna-mime` (`git pull` to update)

```go
		{"audio/flac", ".flac"},
		{"audio/mpeg", ".mpga,.mpega,.mp2,.mp3,.m4a"},
		{"audio/ogg", ".oga,.ogg,.opus,.spx"},
		{"audio/x-wav", ".wav"},
		{"image/tiff", ".tiff,.tif"},
		{"video/dv", ".dif,.dv"},
		{"video/fli", ".fli"},
		{"video/mpeg", ".mpeg,.mpg,.mpe"},
		{"video/MP2T", ".ts"},
		{"video/mp4", ".mp4"},
		{"video/quicktime", ".qt,.mov"},
		{"video/ogg", ".ogv"},
		{"video/webm", ".webm"},
		{"video/x-msvideo", ".avi"},
		{"video/x-matroska", ".mpv,.mkv"},
```

Or for a traditional beta:
https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-219-g40a9755a-fix-3475-dlna-mime-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

issue.title: Serve DLNA not working on Samsung TV

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
TV shows no playable content from DLNA share. I can see it under sources, but after choosing it, it tells me "the content cannot be displayed"

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.47.0-115-g2c72e7f0-beta


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Debian 9, 64 Bit


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone serve dlna remote:Media


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -vvv serve dlna gcrypt:Media/Movies                     
2019/06/11 10:39:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.47.0-115-g2c72e7f0-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vvv" "serve" "dlna" "remote:Media/"]
Enter configuration password:                               
password:
2019/06/11 10:40:04 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2019/06/11 10:40:07 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/forget" to remote control registry
2019/06/11 10:40:07 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/refresh" to remote control registry  
2019/06/11 10:40:07 DEBUG : Adding path "vfs/poll-interval" to remote control registry
2019/06/11 10:40:07 NOTICE: Encrypted drive 'remote:Media/': Serving HTTP on [::]:7879
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on lo
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on vethecf93a0               
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on br-ff002a7d26fd                
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on docker0                        
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on br-7929a085d1c8                 
2019/06/11 10:40:07 INFO  : DLNA server on :7879: Started SSDP on enp3s0                                    
2019/06/11 10:40:13 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.57:53172 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" %!s(<nil>)
2019/06/11 10:40:17 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.57:53173 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" %!s(<nil>)
2019/06/11 10:40:17 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.57:53174 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" %!s(<nil>)
2019/06/11 10:40:21 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.57:53175 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" %!s(<nil>)
2019/06/11 10:40:21 INFO  : /ctl: 192.168.178.57:53176 POST 200 "urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:ContentDirectory:1#Browse" %!s(<nil>)

Every time i clicked on refresh (in the tv), i got 2 of these POST 200 messages.

To check, that the share is working properly i also tested it with VLC on my Android device and got it working. So the combination of rclone-dlna and my Samsung is not working at the moment.

body: The encrypted drive works perfectly, thank you very much for your incredible support!

> The encrypted drive works perfectly, thank you very much for your incredible support!

Great!  I wouldn't have got there without @mt025 so thanks due there too :-)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.49
